intro: Sherbournia calycina, commonly known as the scarlet sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a sprawling growth habit with branching stems that often root at the nodes. Sherbournia calycina is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
